newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Oct federal tax receipts at 7.9 bln reais.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Oct federal tax receipts at 7.9 bln reais.

text.p: Brazil's federal tax receipts totalled 7.9 billion reais in October, down from 8.049 billion reais in September, but up from 7.17 billion reais in October 1995, the Internal Revenue Service said.
The tax office said in a statement tax receipts for the January-to-October period totalled 76.906 billion reais, compared with 69.301 billion reais in the same period a year ago.

In real terms, taking inflation into account, January-to-October tax receipts were 78.91 billion reais versus 79.328 billion reais in January-to-October 1995, a drop of 0.53 percent, the statement said.
The Internal Revenue Service said the fall in tax revenues between September and October was due to seasonal factors:
-- September deadline for personal income tax payment
-- a 76.41 percent drop in quarterly corporate tax payment
